com.ikalagaming.permissions

Class PermissionGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikalagaming.permissions.PermissionGroup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PermissionHolder

    public class PermissionGroup
extends java.lang.Object
implements PermissionHolder
    A group that can be assigned permissions. Entities that are members of these groups are assigned the permissions of the group, as well as any permissions specific to that entity which may have been assigned.
    Groups may have a parent group which they inherit permissions from. Permissions set in a group override permissions set in a parent group if there are any conflicts.
    Author:
    Ches Burks

    • Constructor Detail

      • PermissionGroup

        public PermissionGroup(java.lang.String name,
                       java.util.HashMap<Permission,java.lang.Boolean> newPermissions)
        Constructs a new PermissionGroup with the supplied information. The parent defaults to "root", and the description to an empty string.

        The name is a unique name for the group, which matches the name in configuration files. Errors are thrown if the name is null or empty, or if a group with the supplied name already exists.
        Example: "heroes" or "moderator"

        The permissions are a list of permissions and a boolean indicating if the group is allowed or denied that permission. If the permission is mapped to true, the group has that permission, if it is set to false, it does not. Permissions that are not set use their default value.
        Example: "entity.jump" is mapped to "true"

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the group
        newPermissions - Permissions this group is assigned

      • PermissionGroup

        public PermissionGroup(java.lang.String name,
                       PermissionGroup theParent,
                       java.util.HashMap<Permission,java.lang.Boolean> newPermissions)
        Constructs a new PermissionGroup with the supplied information. The description defaults to an empty string.

        The name is a unique name for the group, which matches the name in configuration files. Errors are thrown if the name is null or empty, or if a group with the supplied name already exists.
        Example: "heroes" or "moderator"

        The parent group is the group this group inherits permissions from. Permissions set in this group override all parent permissions. If no parent is set, it will default to the "root" group.
        Example: "npcs" or "heroes"

        The permissions are a list of permissions and a boolean indicating if the group is allowed or denied that permission. If the permission is mapped to true, the group has that permission, if it is set to false, it does not. Permissions that are not set use their default value.
        Example: "entity.jump" is mapped to "true"

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the group
        theParent - The parent of this group
        newPermissions - Permissions this group is assigned

      • PermissionGroup

        public PermissionGroup(java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.String theDescription,
                       java.util.HashMap<Permission,java.lang.Boolean> newPermissions)
        Constructs a new PermissionGroup with the supplied information. The parent defaults to "root".

        The name is a unique name for the group, which matches the name in configuration files. Errors are thrown if the name is null or empty, or if a group with the supplied name already exists.
        Example: "heroes" or "moderator"

        The description is a brief explanation of the groups purpose. Who is in the group or what it adds/removes from members may be a description. If no description is provided, it defaults to an empty string.
        Examples: "Players that may use all transportation systems" or "Entities that should not die"

        The permissions are a list of permissions and a boolean indicating if the group is allowed or denied that permission. If the permission is mapped to true, the group has that permission, if it is set to false, it does not. Permissions that are not set use their default value.
        Example: "entity.jump" is mapped to "true"

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the group
        theDescription - The description of the group
        newPermissions - Permissions this group is assigned

      • PermissionGroup

        public PermissionGroup(java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.String theDescription,
                       PermissionGroup theParent,
                       java.util.HashMap<Permission,java.lang.Boolean> newPermissions)
        Constructs a new PermissionGroup with the supplied information.

        The name is a unique name for the group, which matches the name in configuration files. Errors are thrown if the name is null or empty, or if a group with the supplied name already exists.
        Example: "heroes" or "moderator"

        The description is a brief explanation of the groups purpose. Who is in the group or what it adds/removes from members may be a description. If no description is provided, it defaults to an empty string.
        Examples: "Players that may use all transportation systems" or "Entities that should not die"

        The parent group is the group this group inherits permissions from. Permissions set in this group override all parent permissions. If no parent is set, it will default to the "root" group.
        Example: "npcs" or "heroes"

        The permissions are a list of permissions and a boolean indicating if the group is allowed or denied that permission. If the permission is mapped to true, the group has that permission, if it is set to false, it does not. Permissions that are not set use their default value.
        Example: "entity.jump" is mapped to "true"

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the group
        theDescription - The description of the group
        theParent - The parent of this group
        newPermissions - Permissions this group is assigned

      • hasPermission

        public boolean hasPermission(Permission perm)
        Description copied from interface: PermissionHolder
        Gets the value of the specified permission, if set.

        If a the permission is not overridden on this object, the default value of the permission will be returned

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • recalculatePermissions

        public void recalculatePermissions()
        Description copied from interface: PermissionHolder
        Recalculates the permissions for this object, if the attachments have changed values.

        This should very rarely need to be called from a plugin.

        Specified by:
        recalculatePermissions in interface PermissionHolder
